p.s: I think Sonnet 65 is a very convincing sonnet that showed really good huh Shakespeare felt about the change.
You could see clearly how much he liked the time before the Dark Lady.
He described it with summer, and pointed out how much she loved it a lot of times.
He called this time the best jewel, which is also very convincing because he was a rich man back then.
He probably owned some jewels but none of them was as beautiful as the time he called summer.
It is very often underlined, how brutal the change to winter, so to the Elizabethan time was, which probably convinced people to start thinking differently about Queen Elizabeth.
I am sure some people did not think about what a huge difference this change would make.
I also think a lot of people thought about how good the time before was, because Shakespeare describe it so beautiful.
So I think Shakespeare did a great job telling people how he was thinking about it but also made an impact on the people and on their mindset.
